features: SAFETY IS OUR #1 PRIORITY: Our training cup with straw lid is made w high-purity grade silicone, free from plastic, BPA, PVC, lead, and phthalates. Soft silicone reduces the potential for injury to developing gums and teeth, nurturing independence and accomplishment.
NEW BY POPULAR DEMAND: The 9oz cup is ideal for older toddlers and can be used for thicker liquids like juice, milk, or smoothies. It can be used as an open cup or a sippy cup with a straw.

IDEAL FOR TRAINING INDEPENDENT DRINKERS: Unlike glass and ceramic cups, our silicone cup is unbreakable and lightweight, allowing your toddler to focus on practicing drinking and sipping. It features a weighted, non-slip base and easy-grip design, enabling your child to firmly hold their cup while learning.

CLEAR VIEW SILICONE TECHNOLOGY: The see-thru silicone and easy-to-read indicator provide measurement consistency for mixing and portion control. With these features, you can easily see what's inside the cup, reducing any anxiety associated with drinking from an unknown cup and keeping track of the remaining amount.

WHAT'S INCLUDED: 1 Olababy 9oz / 270 ml silicone training cup, 1 silicone straw with lid, and 1 straw brush. Safe to use with cold, warm, hot liquids, and solids. Easy to clean by hand or in a dishwasher. Microwave, freezer, and heat safe up to 428F/220C.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If I spent as much time studying in school as I have researching baby cups I could have gotten a doctorates degree. And after everything... I still haven't found the perfect cup, but I haven't given up hope. I like this cup a lot, I got this cup when baby was 7 months to help transition from bottles to straws and cups, baby is 11 months now and I use this cup more than any others.Things I like: It's so cute! I really love the color and that its opaque so I can see how much liquid is in it. It's really easy for my baby to hold. The straw has a stopper so it cant be pulled out. It has a lid and it fits really well. It's super easy to clean (I only hand wash it as silicone can end up holding soap flavor). It has a flared bottom and that's always important. The cup has ounce markers.Things I don't like/wish were different: Volume, I wish it was a little larger, if you fill it too close to the top and put the lid on you will have an overflow, so I can only fill it 3/4th full and need to get a refill through dinner. If the cup is full and it tips over (a.k.a the baby throws it overboard) liquid will spill out of the straw. And lastly price, felt like a lot of money to spend on a cup... but I bought it anyway because I'm desperately seeking perfection.It's pretty good, until I find my perfect match, this one is at the top of my recommend list for a first transition cups.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great starter cup for your baby
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my 9 month old to start her using a straw. Its light weight and easy for her hold. The shape of the lid and bottom of the cup make it easy grab points for her to hold on to. And because of the silcon its easy nonslip for her to hold on to. She loves playing with the straw and it was easy for her to slurp up her first drink of water. Its a very durable cup and the lid stays secure. With many drops and throws onto the floor that lid stays on. It does leak from the straw but that is to be expected because its normal silcon straw. The straw does not have one of those stopper or restricters on them because its suppose to be an easy to suck straw. So expect liquid on the floor or table if left with the child unattended. My daughter loves to chew on the cup and straw which is actually encouraging her to want to play with the cup and use it more. It came with a sturdy straw cleaner which helps make the cleaning process even simpler. This cup is great and I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Minimal leakage, easy for 10 month old to use
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my 10 month old twins. I wanted something they could easily hold, not pull the straw out of, and get the water up without a lot of force sucking. Having never used a straw before they took to these immediately! They are the perfect size (5 ounce) for them to grasp. They will leak if thrown on the floor but are fine if tipped over on their high chairs. They are also SUPER easy to clean with minimal parts and no fancy valves. Definitely worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It does leak, good for little hands
reviews.reviewText: The product is pretty sturdy, easy to clean, but it leaks. It leaks pretty easy when knocked over and also when upside down. I mean alot, not drops. It's a good cup for little hands and for teether. Just be aware it does leak.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice design and good quality
reviews.reviewText: Like the measuring mark design, and the silicone material ensures safety for my child. There has been no leaking issue for far. Plus, cleaning is a breeze. Highly satisfied!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome training cup
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This cup is great I’ve used many training cups and this one has taught my 14 month old quickly to drink from a straw. It has weighted bottom so the cup does not get knocked over so easily. I wouldn’t say it’s leak proof cause some liquid does come out but not a lot very tiny. It’s very easy to clean and it comes with a brush to clean the straw. I will be getting more colors for my little one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars My baby enjoys it but it leaks a lot
reviews.reviewText: We got this for our 11-month-old baby who refuses to take a bottle but isn't quite ready for a sippy cup. He does great getting the water out of this straw, but it does leak a lot from between the cup and the lid, and if it is turned upside down it leaks a lot too. We only give it to him in his high chair with a bib. It's a good size for him and he's able to hold it well even though there aren't handles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Perfect cup for my 7 month old! Super cute, safe and easy to clean
